channel.title: Comments on: Post to a rest api in Dynamics NAV

item.title: By: Bart
item.dc:creator: Bart
item.description: Hi, I have a problem running CU 1297 on NAS server. My integration works perfectly fine on the client version (no errors, no dialog windows, nothing), but whenever I run it on NAS it complains about client callbacks for all dotnet variables CU 1297 is using. All of them are already set up not to run on client (as suggested in some forums) but that is not solving the problem. Is it possible to run CU1297 on NAS as all, and if not, is there any alternative to it which would work on NAS?
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
I have a problem running CU 1297 on NAS server. My integration works perfectly fine on the client version (no errors, no dialog windows, nothing), but whenever I run it on NAS it complains about client callbacks for all dotnet variables CU 1297 is using. All of them are already set up not to run on client (as suggested in some forums) but that is not solving the problem. Is it possible to run CU1297 on NAS as all, and if not, is there any alternative to it which would work on NAS?

item.title: By: Prakash Kumar
item.dc:creator: Prakash Kumar
item.description:
Hi Jaspreet,
These are very excellent articles and it helps alot, but I am stuck at a point where I am trying to call a URL which uses SSO(single sign on) and there it asks for credentials, even though I have supplied the correct credentials to the HttpWebRequest.Credential property still getting issue of 401 un authorized error.
Can you please help in my case.
Regards, Prakash
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jaspreet,

These are very excellent articles and it helps alot, but I am stuck at a point where I am trying to call a URL which uses SSO(single sign on) and there it asks for credentials, even though I have supplied the correct credentials to the HttpWebRequest.Credential property still getting issue of 401 un authorized error.

Can you please help in my case.

Regards,
Prakash

item.title: By: jaspreet
item.dc:creator: jaspreet
item.description: Hi Donah, Nav 2017 already has the .dll included in the program files location. But downloading ensures you have the latest version.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Donah,
Nav 2017 already has the .dll included in the program files location. But downloading ensures you have the latest version.

item.title: By: Donah
item.dc:creator: Donah
item.description: Solved. I was able to download the Newtonsoft.Json dll and include it in the program data dll. Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Solved. I was able to download the Newtonsoft.Json dll and include it in the program data dll.
Thanks

item.title: By: Donah
item.dc:creator: Donah
item.description:
Thanks for this post, i was trying to create a variable for Json Object. i got this error
Could not load type Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.Jobject.'Newtonsoft.Json, Version=6.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=30ad4fe6b2a6aeed'.
What can i do?
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for this post, i was trying to create a variable for Json Object. i got this error

Could not load type Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.Jobject.’Newtonsoft.Json, Version=6.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=30ad4fe6b2a6aeed’.

What can i do?

Thanks

item.title: By: jaspreet
item.dc:creator: jaspreet
item.description:
Can you mail me the txt file of your code (find it in my Contact me page). I will have a look and see if I can find something
Version should not matter
item.content:encoded:
Can you mail me the txt file of your code (find it in my Contact me page).
I will have a look and see if I can find something

Version should not matter

item.title: By: Kenneth
item.dc:creator: Kenneth
item.description:
Okay, Update! I've downgradet newtonsoft to 6.0.1 and now i get a new error: A DotNet variable has not been instantiated. Attempting to call Tostring in CodeUnit (mycodeunitname): InitializeHttpPost. I know what it means.. but why? :D I'm assuming that it's the MESSAGE(JObject.GetValue('job').ToString). I've change 'job' to 'pdf' since that the json property name i want the value of.
I'm sry for the frequest questions and i thank you for your time. Please feel free to remove all my question so your blog dosn't look all messy :)
item.content:encoded:
Okay, Update! I’ve downgradet newtonsoft to 6.0.1 and now i get a new error:
A DotNet variable has not been instantiated. Attempting to call Tostring in CodeUnit (mycodeunitname): InitializeHttpPost.
I know what it means.. but why? ðŸ˜€
I’m assuming that it’s the MESSAGE(JObject.GetValue(‘job’).ToString).
I’ve change ‘job’ to ‘pdf’ since that the json property name i want the value of.

I’m sry for the frequest questions and i thank you for your time.
Please feel free to remove all my question so your blog dosn’t look all messy ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Kenneth
item.dc:creator: Kenneth
item.description: Well okay.. I've changes nothing and now it goes through. I do get an error on the Newtonesoft.json.dll. And I've tried both a .Net 4.5 and 4.0 version. It says: Could Not Load an instance of the following .NET Framework object: Newtonesoft.jon.dll version 10.0.0.0... and so on.
item.content:encoded:
Well okay.. I’ve changes nothing and now it goes through.
I do get an error on the Newtonesoft.json.dll.
And I’ve tried both a .Net 4.5 and 4.0 version.
It says: Could Not Load an instance of the following .NET Framework object: Newtonesoft.jon.dll version 10.0.0.0… and so on.

item.title: By: jaspreet
item.dc:creator: jaspreet
item.description:
If you are talking about the response then you already get it in BLOB so you are fine using READASTEXT.
If you are talking about the body that you will be posting to the api and want to post more than just text, You can. In the HttpWebRequest codeunit there are other AddBody functions where you can even post a BLOB to the api.
item.content:encoded:
If you are talking about the response then you already get it in BLOB so you are fine using READASTEXT.

If you are talking about the body that you will be posting to the api and want to post more than just text, You can.
In the HttpWebRequest codeunit there are other AddBody functions where you can even post a BLOB to the api.

item.title: By: Kenneth
item.dc:creator: Kenneth
item.description: Thx for the fast reply. Let me try to explain. I think maybe i don't understand the code. I POST body. This gives me an answer with a 8000 lenght text. Where does the code fail? I know it's because it's to big, and BIGTEXT would fix this. But what do i change to make sure that i'm able to get the response into a BIGTEXT object or storage instead of text (which is to small to handle 8k)?
item.content:encoded:
Thx for the fast reply.
Let me try to explain. I think maybe i don’t understand the code.
I POST body.
This gives me an answer with a 8000 lenght text.
Where does the code fail? I know it’s because it’s to big, and BIGTEXT would fix this.
But what do i change to make sure that i’m able to get the response into a BIGTEXT object or storage instead of text (which is to small to handle 8k)?
